intro: Phacelia suaveolens subsp. keckii, commonly known as Keck's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has a short growing season and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates. Its flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity.
